title: What are the differences among metal, heavy metal, and hard rock? - Quora

response.answer_text: Metal A big genre of rock which has its own genre.Has sub-genres like death, black, speed, traditional heavy, power, progressive etc metal.Has two main sections - extreme and non-extreme metal.Fast tempo, brutal riffs, screaming voice.Prominent bands - Metallica (thrash metal), Death (death metal), Mayhem (Black Metal), Iron Maiden (traditional heavy metal), Helloween (power metal), Dream Theater (progressive metal)Heavy Metal Usually same as metal but heavy metal is referred as traditional heavy metalFast tempo, long solos, heavy riffs, powerful voiceProminent bands - Iron Maiden, Judas Priest, Black Sabbath, Deep Purple, Dio, Rainbow etcHard Rock A sub-genre of rock which doesn’t have its own sub-genresHeavy but not fast. Usually mid to slow tempoInspired from blues, garage or rock n roll music.Prominent bands - Led Zeppelin, AC/DC, The Who, Guns N’ Roses etc.

Metal and rock are both related but do have major differences. Heavy ness is a more loose way to differentiate the too, but metal puts a greater emphasis on emotion, beauty, epicness and adventure than rock, which is about lighter, less serious things. Metal to me is rock music tuned for performance over just sound. I got bored listening to acdc and guns n roses and started listening to iron maiden . I no longer feel the need to listen to rock because there isn't much more it offers in comparison to metal.
